body_html:
For a long time, the following pattern has been standard in TF for files that were used for exporting API keywords:

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function

from blah import keywords

del absolute_import
del division
del print_function

This is no longer the case since API export now relies on decorators. @annarev, what should we do with existing files using the above pattern?
body_text:
For a long time, the following pattern has been standard in TF for files that were used for exporting API keywords:
from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function

from blah import keywords

del absolute_import
del division
del print_function
This is no longer the case since API export now relies on decorators. @annarev, what should we do with existing files using the above pattern?
body:
For a long time, the following pattern has been standard in TF for files that were used for exporting API keywords:

```python
from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function

from blah import keywords

del absolute_import
del division
del print_function
```

This is no longer the case since API export now relies on decorators. @annarev, what should we do with existing files using the above pattern?
